member.name: T:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFile
member.summary: Represents a memory-mapped file.

member.name: M:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFile.CreateFromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a memory-mapped file from a file on disk.
member.param: The path to file to map.
member.returns: A memory-mapped file.
member.exception: path is an empty string, contains only white space, or has one or more invalid characters, as defined by the method. -or- path refers to an invalid device.
path is null.
An I/O error occurred.
path exceeds the maximum length defined by the operating system. In Windows, paths must contain fewer than 248 characters, and file names must contain fewer than 260 characters.
The caller does not have the required permissions for the file.

Access mode; must be .
member.returns: A memory-mapped file that has the specified access mode.

path is null.

path exceeds the maximum length defined by the operating system. In Windows, paths must contain fewer than 248 characters, and file names must contain fewer than 260 characters.
The caller does not have the required permissions for the file.

member.name: M:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFile.CreateFromFile(System.String,System.IO.FileMode,System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates a memory-mapped file that has the specified access mode, name, and capacity from a file on disk.
member.param: The path to the file to map.
Access mode; can be any of the enumeration values except .
A name to assign to the memory-mapped file.
The maximum size, in bytes, to allocate to the memory-mapped file. Specify 0 to set the capacity to the size of the file on disk.
member.returns: A memory-mapped file that has the specified characteristics.
member.exception: path is an empty string, contains only white space, or has one or more invalid characters, as defined by the method. -or- path refers to an invalid device. -or- mapName is an empty string. -or- mode is .
path or mapName is null.

capacity is greater than the size of the logical address space. -or- capacity is less than zero. -or- capacity is less than the file size (but not zero). -or- capacity is zero, and the size of the file on disk is also zero.
An I/O error occurred.
path exceeds the maximum length defined by the operating system. In Windows, paths must contain fewer than 248 characters, and file names must contain fewer than 260 characters.
The caller does not have the required permissions for the file.

member.name: M:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFile.CreateFromFile(System.String,System.IO.FileMode,System.String,System.Int64,System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileAccess)
member.summary: Creates a memory-mapped file that has the specified access mode, name, capacity, and access type from a file on disk.
member.param: The path to the file to map.
Access mode; can be any of the enumeration values except .
A name to assign to the memory-mapped file.
The maximum size, in bytes, to allocate to the memory-mapped file. Specify 0 to set the capacity to the size of the file on disk.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the type of access allowed to the memory-mapped file.
member.returns: A memory-mapped file that has the specified characteristics.
member.exception: mapName is an empty string. -or- access is not an allowed value. -or- path specifies an empty file. -or- access is specified as and capacity is greater than the size of the file indicated by path. -or- mode is .
path or mapName is null.

capacity is greater than the size of the logical address space. -or- capacity is less than zero. -or- capacity is less than the file size (but not zero). -or- capacity is zero, and the size of the file on disk is also zero. -or- access is not a defined value. -or- The size of the file indicated by path is greater than capacity.
-or- An I/O error occurred.
path exceeds the maximum length defined by the operating system. In Windows, paths must contain fewer than 248 characters, and file names must contain fewer than 260 characters.
The caller does not have the required permissions for the file.

member.name: M:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFile.CreateFromFile(System.IO.FileStream,System.String,System.Int64,System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileAccess,System.IO.HandleInheritability,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a memory-mapped file from an existing file with the specified access mode, name, inheritability, and capacity.
member.param: The file stream of the existing file.
A name to assign to the memory-mapped file.
The maximum size, in bytes, to allocate to the memory-mapped file. Specify 0 to set the capacity to the size of filestream.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the type of access allowed to the memory-mapped file. This parameter can’t be set to .
One of the enumeration values that specifies whether a handle to the memory-mapped file can be inherited by a child process. The default is .
A value that indicates whether to close the source file stream when the is disposed.
member.returns: A memory-mapped file that has the specified characteristics.
member.exception: mapName is null or an empty string. -or- capacity and the length of the file are zero. -or- access is set to or enumeration value, which is not allowed. -or- access is set to and capacity is larger than the length of filestream.
fileStream is null.
capacity is less than zero. -or- capacity is less than the file size. -or- access is not a valid enumeration value. -or- inheritability is not a valid enumeration value.

member.name: M:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFile.CreateNew(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates a memory-mapped file that has the specified capacity in system memory.
member.param: A name to assign to the memory-mapped file.
The maximum size, in bytes, to allocate to the memory-mapped file.
member.returns: A memory-mapped file that has the specified name and capacity.
member.exception: mapName is an empty string.
mapName is null.
capacity is less than or equal to zero.

member.summary: Creates a memory-mapped file that has the specified capacity and access type in system memory.
member.param: A name to assign to the memory-mapped file.
The maximum size, in bytes, to allocate to the memory-mapped file.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the type of access allowed to the memory-mapped file. The default is .
member.returns: A memory-mapped file that has the specified characteristics.
member.exception: mapName is an empty string. -or- access is set to write-only with the enumeration value.
mapName is null.
capacity is less than or equal to zero. -or- access is not a valid enumeration value.

member.name: M:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFile.CreateNew(System.String,System.Int64,System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileAccess,System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileOptions,System.IO.HandleInheritability)
member.summary: Creates a memory-mapped file that has the specified name, capacity, access type, memory allocation options and inheritability.
member.param: A name to assign to the memory-mapped file.
The maximum size, in bytes, to allocate to the memory-mapped file.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the type of access allowed to the memory-mapped file. The default is .
A bitwise combination of enumeration values that specifies memory allocation options for the memory-mapped file.
A value that specifies whether a handle to the memory-mapped file can be inherited by a child process. The default is .
member.returns: A memory-mapped file that has the specified characteristics.
member.exception: mapName is an empty string. -or- access is set to write-only with the enumeration value.
mapName is null.
capacity is less than or equal to zero. -or- access is not a valid enumeration value. -or- inheritability is not a valid value.

member.name: M:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFile.CreateOrOpen(System.String,System.Int64,System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileAccess,System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileOptions,System.IO.HandleInheritability)
member.summary: Creates a new empty memory mapped file or opens an existing memory mapped file if one exists with the same name. If opening an existing file, the capacity, options, and memory arguments will be ignored.
member.param: A name to assign to the memory-mapped file.
The maximum size, in bytes, to allocate to the memory-mapped file.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the type of access allowed to the memory-mapped file. The default is .
A bitwise combination of values that indicate the memory allocation options to apply to the file.
A value that specifies whether a handle to the memory-mapped file can be inherited by a child process. The default is .
member.returns: A memory-mapped file that has the specified characteristics.
member.exception: mapName is an empty string. -or- access is set to write-only with the enumeration value.
mapName is null.

capacity is greater than the size of the logical address space. -or- capacity is less than or equal to zero. -or- access is not a valid enumeration value. -or- inheritability is not a valid enumeration value.

member.name: M:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFile.CreateViewAccessor
member.summary: Creates a that maps to a view of the memory-mapped file.
member.returns: A randomly accessible block of memory.
member.exception: Access to the memory-mapped file is unauthorized.

member.name: M:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFile.CreateViewAccessor(System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates a that maps to a view of the memory-mapped file, and that has the specified offset and size.
member.param: The byte at which to start the view.
The size of the view. Specify 0 (zero) to create a view that starts at offset and ends approximately at the end of the memory-mapped file.
member.returns: A randomly accessible block of memory.
member.exception: offset or size is a negative value. -or- size is greater than the logical address space.
Access to the memory-mapped file is unauthorized.
An I/O error occurred.

member.name: M:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFile.CreateViewAccessor(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileAccess)
member.summary: Creates a that maps to a view of the memory-mapped file, and that has the specified offset, size, and access restrictions.
member.param: The byte at which to start the view.
The size of the view. Specify 0 (zero) to create a view that starts at offset and ends approximately at the end of the memory-mapped file.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the type of access allowed to the memory-mapped file. The default is .
member.returns: A randomly accessible block of memory.
member.exception: offset or size is a negative value. -or- size is greater than the logical address space.
access is invalid for the memory-mapped file.
An I/O error occurred.

member.summary: Creates a stream that maps to a view of the memory-mapped file.

size is greater than the total virtual memory.

member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: P:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFile.SafeMemoryMappedFileHandle
member.summary: Gets the file handle of a memory-mapped file.
member.returns: The handle to the memory-mapped file.

member.name: T:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileAccess
member.summary: Specifies access capabilities and restrictions for a memory-mapped file or view.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileAccess.CopyOnWrite
member.summary: Read and write access to the file, with the restriction that any write operations will not be seen by other processes.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileAccess.Read
member.summary: Read-only access to the file.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileAccess.ReadExecute
member.summary: Read access to the file that can store and run executable code.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileAccess.ReadWrite
member.summary: Read and write access to the file.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileAccess.ReadWriteExecute
member.summary: Read and write access to the file that can can store and run executable code.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileAccess.Write
member.summary: Write-only access to file.

member.name: T:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileOptions
member.summary: Provides memory allocation options for memory-mapped files.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileOptions.DelayAllocatePages
member.summary: Memory allocation is delayed until a view is created with either the or method.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileOptions.None
member.summary: No memory allocation options are applied.

member.name: T:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights
member.summary: Specifies access rights to a memory-mapped file that is not associated with a file on disk.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.AccessSystemSecurity
member.summary: The right to get or set permissions on a file.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.ChangePermissions
member.summary: The right to change the security and audit rules associated with a file.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.CopyOnWrite
member.summary: The right to read and write to a file with the restriction that write operations will not be seen by other processes.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.Delete
member.summary: The right to delete a file.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.Execute
member.summary: The right to run an application file.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.FullControl
member.summary: The right to exert full control over a file, and to modify access control and audit rules. This value represents the right to do anything with a file and is the combination of all rights in this enumeration.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.Read
member.summary: The right to open and copy a file as read-only.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.ReadExecute
member.summary: The right to open and copy a folder or file as read-only, and to run application files. This right includes the right and the right.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.ReadPermissions
member.summary: The right to open and copy access and audit rules from a file. This does not include the right to read data, file system attributes, or extended file system attributes.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.ReadWrite
member.summary: The right to open and copy a file, and the right to add data to a file or remove data from a file.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.ReadWriteExecute
member.summary: The right to open and copy a file, the right to add data to a file or remove data from a file, and the right to run an application file.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.TakeOwnership
member.summary: The right to change the owner of a file.

member.name: F:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedFileRights.Write
member.summary: The right to add data to a file or remove data from a file.

member.name: T:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedViewAccessor
member.summary: Represents a randomly accessed view of a memory-mapped file.

member.name: M:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedViewAccessor.Flush
member.summary: Clears all buffers for this view and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying file.
member.exception: Methods were called after the accessor was closed.

member.name: P:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedViewAccessor.PointerOffset
member.summary: [Supported in the .NET Framework 4.5.1 and later versions] Gets the number of bytes by which the starting position of this view is offset from the beginning of the memory-mapped file.
member.returns: The number of bytes between the starting position of this view and the beginning of the memory-mapped file.
member.exception: The object from which this instance was created is null.

member.name: P:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedViewAccessor.SafeMemoryMappedViewHandle
member.summary: Gets a handle to the view of a memory-mapped file.
member.returns: A wrapper for the operating system's handle to the view of the file.

member.name: T:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedViewStream
member.summary: Represents a view of a memory-mapped file as a sequentially accessed stream.

member.name: M:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedViewStream.Flush
member.summary: Clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying file.

member.name: P:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedViewStream.PointerOffset
member.summary: [Supported in the .NET Framework 4.5.1 and later versions] Gets the number of bytes by which the starting position of this view is offset from the beginning of the memory-mapped file.
member.returns: The number of bytes between the starting position of this view and the beginning of the memory-mapped file.
member.exception: The object from which this instance was created is null.

member.name: P:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedViewStream.SafeMemoryMappedViewHandle
member.summary: Gets a handle to the view of a memory-mapped file.
member.returns: A wrapper for the operating system's handle to the view of the file.

member.name: M:System.IO.MemoryMappedFiles.MemoryMappedViewStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the length of the current stream.
member.param: The desired length of the current stream in bytes.
member.exception: This method is not supported.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeMemoryMappedFileHandle
member.summary: Provides a safe handle that represents a memory-mapped file for sequential access.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeMemoryMappedViewHandle
member.summary: Provides a safe handle that represents a view of a block of unmanaged memory for random access.
